70P1sWCH.question: You are navigating in the Northern hemisphere based on a chart with a convergency of 30° between your departure and destination. Which statement below is correct?.

options.text: Your great circle track will change by 30° throughout the flight.
The convergency north of your position will be greater than 30°.
The convergency north of your position will be smaller than 30°.
The rhumb line track will differ from the great circle track by 30° at your halfway point.

avv5ClyH.question: Two places are situated on the same parallel in the Southern Hemisphere. The great circle, rhumb line and the straight line between these places are drawn on a Polar Stereographic Projection. Which statement is correct?

options.text: The great circle is situated between the parallel and the straight line, because the concave side of the great circle is always pointed towards the pole.
The rhumb line is situated between the great circle and the straight line because the shortest distance between to places on Earth is the great circle.
The great circle is situated between the parallel and the straight line, because the concave side of the great circle is always pointed towards the equator.
The correct sequence from North to South is: Great circle, straight line, rhumb line.

options.text: The closer to the pole, the more a great circle equals a straight line.
Rhumb Lines are always concave to the nearest pole.
In mid-latitudes, a great circle is convex towards the nearest pole.
The distance of a straight line in NM is always longer than the distance of a great circle in NM.

pcCdWGWR.question:
Calculate the ETA at the destination, given:
An aircraft departing from the western hemisphere, flying along the equator to the eastern hemisphere, crossing the date line on a westerly heading. The difference between the location and the destination is 15° of longitude. Date and time of departure is 12:00 LMT on the 14th of August. Aircraft travels at an average ground speed of 300 kt.
